org.apparatus_templi

Class Coordinator

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apparatus_templi.Coordinator

  • public class Coordinator
extends Object
    Coordinates message passing and driver loading. Handles setting up the environment, querying remote modules, loading drivers, and starting the front end support. Coordinator provides wrapper methods to facilitate communication between the front end, drivers, and the remote modules.
    Author:
    Jonathan Nelson

    • Method Detail

      • sendCommand

        static boolean sendCommand(Driver caller,
                  String command)
        Sends the given command to a specific remote module. The message will be formatted to fit the protocol version that this module supports (if known), otherwise the message will be formatted as the most recent protocol version.
        Parameters:
        caller - a reference to the calling Driver
        command - the command to send to the remote module

      • sendCommandAndWait

        static String sendCommandAndWait(Driver caller,
                        String command,
                        int waitPeriod)
        Sends a message to a remote module and waits waitPeriod seconds for a response.
        Parameters:
        caller - a reference to the calling Driver
        command - the command to send to the remote module
        waitPeriod - how many seconds to wait for a response. Maximum period to wait is 6 seconds.
        Returns:
        the String of data that the remote module responded with, or null if there was no response. Note that the first incoming response is returned. If another message addressed to this

      • sendBinary

        static boolean sendBinary(Driver caller,
                 byte[] data)
        Sends binary data over the serial connection to a remote module. Does not yet break byte[] into chunks for transmission. Make sure that the size of the transmission is not larger than a single packet's max payload size (around 80 bytes).
        Parameters:
        caller - a reference to the calling Driver
        data - the binary data to send

      • storeTextData

        static int storeTextData(String driverName,
                String dataTag,
                String data)
        Stores the given data to persistent storage. Data is tagged with both the driver name as well as a data tag.
        Parameters:
        driverName - the name of the driver to store the data under
        dataTag - a tag to assign to this data. This tag should be specific for each data block that your driver stores. If there already exits data for the given dataTag the old data will be overwritten.
        data - the string of data to store
        Returns:
        -1 if data overwrote information from a previous dataTag. 1 if data was written successfully. 0 if the data could not be written.

      • storeBinData

        static int storeBinData(String driverName,
               String dataTag,
               byte[] data)
        Stores the given data to persistent storage. Data is stored based off the given driverName and dataTag.
        Parameters:
        driverName - the name of the driver to store the data under
        dataTag - a unique tag to assign to this data. This tag should be specific for each data block that will be stored. If data has already been stored with the same driverName and dataTag the old data will be overwritten.
        data - the data to be stored
        Returns:
        -1 if data overwrote information from a previous dataTag. 1 if data was written successfully. 0 if the data could not be written.

      • readTextData

        static String readTextData(String driverName,
                  String dataTag)
        Returns text data previously stored under the given module name and tag.
        Parameters:
        driverName - the name of the calling driver
        dataTag - the tag to uniquely identify the data
        Returns:
        the stored String data, or null if no data has been stored under the given driver name and tag.

      • readBinData

        static Byte[] readBinData(String driverName,
                 String dataTag)
        Returns binary data previously stored under the given module name and tag.
        Parameters:
        driverName - the name of the calling driver
        dataTag - the tag to uniquely identify the data
        Returns:
        the stored binary data, or null if no data has been stored under the given driver name and tag.

      • scheduleWakup

        static void scheduleWakup(Driver caller,
                 long wakeTime)
        Schedules a Driver to wake at the given time. If a driver's state Driver.getState() is Thread.State.TERMINATED at the time of the wake up the Driver will be restarted. If the Driver's state is not TERMINATED then no action will be taken.
        Parameters:
        caller -
        wakeTime -

      • passCommand

        static boolean passCommand(String source,
                  String destination,
                  String command)
        Pass a message to the driver specified by name.
        Parameters:
        destination - the unique name of the driver
        source - the source of this message, either the name of the calling driver or null. If null, this command originated from the Coordinator
        command - the command to pass

      • requestWidgetXML

        static String requestWidgetXML(String driverName)
        Requests the XML data representing a drivers status from the given driver.
        Parameters:
        driverName - the unique name of the driver to query
        Returns:
        the String representation of the XML data, or null if the driver does not exist

      • requestFullPageXML

        static String requestFullPageXML(String driverName)
        Requests the XML data representing a driver's detailed controls.
        Parameters:
        driverName - the unique name of the driver to query
        Returns:
        the String representation of the XML data, or null if the driver does not exist

      • isModulePresent

        static boolean isModulePresent(String moduleName)
        Checks the list of known remote modules. If the module is not present the Coordinator may re-query the remote modules for updates.
        Parameters:
        moduleName - the name of the remote module to check for
        Returns:
        true if the remote module is known to be up, false otherwise

      • getSensorList

        static ArrayList<String> getSensorList(String driverName)
        Returns a list of sensors that the given driver monitors.
        Parameters:
        driverName - the unique name of the driver to query
        Returns:
        an ArrayList of Strings representing all sensors monitored by the driver. If the given driver is not of type SensorModule.TYPE or if the driver is not loaded then returns null.

      • getControllerList

        static ArrayList<String> getControllerList(String driverName)
        Returns a list of controllers that the given driver interacts with.
        Parameters:
        driverName - the unique name of the driver to query
        Returns:
        an ArrayList of Strings representing all controllers this driver interacts with. If the given driver is not of type ControllerModule.TYPE or if the driver is not loaded then returns null.

      • getLoadedDrivers

        static ArrayList<String> getLoadedDrivers()
        Returns a list of all loaded drivers.
        Returns:
        an ArrayList of Strings of driver names. If no drivers are loaded then returns an empty list.

        public static void main(String[] argv)
                 throws InterruptedException,
                        IOException
        Throws:
        InterruptedException
        IOException
